title: Aloft Hotels launch emoji room service
text:
Police investigating death of a man in Kaitaia supermarket carpark Aloft Hotels launch emoji room service Last updated 09:47, October 22 2015 Aloft Hotels 
Aloft Hotels have just launched their new emoji menu. 
An American hotel chain is making life that little bit easier for those travellers who are too tired (lazy) to talk, with the launch of a new emoji service called Text it, Get it. 
Each room in the Manhattan-based Aloft Hotel will have a menu of six emoji packages you can order from. 
To do this you simply text a select few emojis - along with your name and room number- to the hotel. 
Guests will then receive a confirmation and their order will follow. 
"The Munchies" and the "Surprise Me" are two of the services available. Image: Aloft Hotels 
"Our guests can now talk to us like they talk to each other" Paige Francis, vice president of global marketing for Starwood Hotels, told Mashable . 
At present the emoji menu is limited, but includes packages such as "The Hangover" - which uses the water droplet, pill and a banana emoji, which in reality translates into vitaminwater, Advil (ibuprofen) and a two bananas. 
"The Munchies" and the "Surprise Me" are also available.
